title: Education Costs in Brunei
content:
The cost of education in Brunei varies depending on the type of institution and the student's residency status, with public education being generally free or subsidized for local students, while private and international schools charge tuition fees ranging from $1,000 to $10,000 per year.

[FACTBOX]
Education Spend (% GDP): 3.8% (2020 est.)
Literacy Rate: 95%
School System: 12 years of compulsory education
Academic Year: 12 months
Currency: BND
[/FACTBOX]

[SECTION] Education System Overview [/SECTION]
The education system in Brunei is divided into public and private sectors, with the public sector offering free or subsidized education to local students. The language of instruction is Malay, but English is also widely used, especially in private and international schools. Compulsory education in Brunei lasts for 12 years, from primary to secondary level, and students can choose to attend public or private schools. International schools are also available, offering curricula such as the International Baccalaureate (IB) and the General Certificate of Education (GCE).

The quality of education in Brunei is generally high, with public schools offering a good standard of education, although some may lack resources and facilities compared to private schools. Private schools, on the other hand, offer a more exclusive and personalized education experience, with smaller class sizes and better facilities. International schools cater to expatriate students and offer a more global perspective on education, with curricula that are recognized internationally.

[SECTION] School Fees [/SECTION]
[TABLE]
| School Type | Annual Fee (USD) | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Public Primary | $0 (free) | High-quality education, but may lack resources |
| Private Primary | $1,000-$3,000 | Range of prices depending on school tier and facilities |
| Public Secondary | $0 (free) | Good standard of education, but may have limited extracurricular activities |
| Private Secondary | $2,000-$6,000 | Better facilities and more extracurricular activities, but higher fees |
| International School | $5,000-$10,000 | Offers IB or GCE curriculum, with high-quality facilities and experienced teachers |
[/TABLE]

[SECTION] Other Education Costs [/SECTION]

| School Supplies (annual) | $50-$100 | School supplies, such as uniforms and textbooks, are relatively affordable |
| School Uniform | $20-$50 | School uniforms are required for most schools, and can be purchased at relatively low cost |
[/TABLE]

[SECTION] Education Quality & Tips [/SECTION]
- The best schools for expats in Brunei are international schools, which offer a global perspective on education and a recognized curriculum.
- Scholarships are available for local and international students, with the government offering scholarships to students who excel academically.
- Online learning options are available, with some universities and schools offering online courses and degree programs.
- The education quality in Brunei is generally high, but may vary depending on the institution and the student's individual experience.
- Expats should research schools thoroughly and consider factors such as curriculum, facilities, and extracurricular activities when choosing a school for their children.
- [CALLOUT] It's also important to consider the cost of living in Brunei, which can be relatively high, especially for expats who are used to a Western standard of living.
